dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, uh, crypto has been, like, *wild* lately, right? Bitcoin, ethereum, it’s all over the place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, uh, crypto has been, like, wild lately, right? Bitcoin, ethereum, it's all over the place.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. Bitcoin, for example, it's actually up almost 50% since its low back in April. You know, after hitting nearly $65,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. Bitcoin, for example, it's actually up almost fifty percent since its low back in April. You know, after hitting nearly sixty five thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bitcoin price has lost almost 50% of its value since hitting its all-time high of nearly $65,000 per bitcoin in April.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and ethereum too! I saw it dropped below $4,000 earlier this month, but now it's, uh, more than half up from that. So it's been a pretty good run for both.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and ethereum too! I saw it dropped below four thousand dollars earlier this month, but now it's, uh, more than half up from that. So it's been a pretty good run for both.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, ethereum is down by more than half after climbing to over $4,000 per ether token earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It has, but here’s where it gets interesting. Wall Street giant Goldman Sachs recently, um, put out a report that was pretty critical of ethereum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It has, but here's where it gets interesting. Wall Street giant Goldman Sachs recently, um, put out a report that was pretty critical of ethereum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, a leaked report from Wall Street giant Goldman Sachs GS +1.8% has given ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency with a market capitalization of around $250 billion compared to bitcoin's $660 billion, a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of valuecalling it the Amazon AMZN -1.4% of information.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I heard about that! [overlaps] Didn't they like, call it the "Amazon of garbage" or something wild like that? Though I think those sections were, you know, later debunked.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I heard about that! Didn't they like, call it the Amazon of garbage or something wild like that? Though I think those sections were, you know, later debunked.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...calling it the Amazon AMZN -1.4% of information.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Exactly! They were, uh, reportedly *debunked sections* of a report shared on Twitter. But the gist was, they downgraded ethereum, saying it had a low chance of succeeding bitcoin as a "failing store of value."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! They were, uh, reportedly debunked sections of a report shared on Twitter. But the gist was, they downgraded ethereum, saying it had a low chance of succeeding bitcoin as a failing store of value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given the importance of real uses in determining the store of value, ether has a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value, analysts at Goldman Sachs wrote, according to leaked sections of the report shared on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "A failing store of value." Wow. I mean, what was their reasoning for such, uh, strong language?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A failing store of value. Wow. I mean, what was their reasoning for such, uh, strong language?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they pointed to a few things. They claimed the "collapsing popularity" of centralized finance – or DeFi – built on crypto, was hampering ethereum. Also, that fungible tokens, largely on ethereum's blockchain, were destroying art and collectibles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they pointed to a few things. They claimed the collapsing popularity of centralized finance - or D E F I - built on crypto, was hampering ethereum. Also, that fungible tokens, largely on ethereum's blockchain, were destroying art and collectibles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The soaring popularity of so-called decentralized finance, using cryptocurrency technology to recreate traditional financial instruments such as loans and interest and designed to replace the role of banks with blockchain-based protocols, has helped ethereum surge over the last year. Non-fungible tokens, largely issued on ethereum's blockchain, to digitalize art and collectibles have added another use case.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but isn't that kinda backwards? I thought most DeFi applications *aren't* even being built on the ethereum network, and a lot of those fungible tokens, like NFTs, are actually purchased using bitcoin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but isn't that kinda backwards? I thought most D E F I applications aren't even being built on the ethereum network, and a lot of those fungible tokens, like N F Ts, are actually purchased using bitcoin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most decentralized finance (DeFi) applications are being built on the ethereum network, and most non-fungible tokens (NFTs) issued are purchased using ether.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s what some analysts are saying, yeah. The numbers also show fewer transactions in ether compared to bitcoin. But, to be fair, over the last 12 months, ethereum actually saw a 1,000% increase, while bitcoin was around 300%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what some analysts are saying, yeah. The numbers also show fewer transactions in ether compared to bitcoin. But, to be fair, over the last twelve months, ethereum actually saw a ten hundred percent increase, while bitcoin was around three hundred percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The greater number of transactions in ether versus bitcoin reflects this dominance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. [overlaps] So it's not all doom and gloom, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. So it's not all doom and gloom, then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not entirely, no. But some people are also worried about ethereum’s long-delayed upgrades, which started late last year. They’re designed to, um, increase its scale, but could actually make transaction costs even higher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not entirely, no. But some people are also worried about ethereum's long-delayed upgrades, which started late last year. They're designed to, um, increase its scale, but could actually make transaction costs even higher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...long-awaited upgrades to ethereum, begun at the end of last year and designed to help ethereum scale and reduce its sky-high transaction costs, could help the ether price reach never-before-seen heights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and I remember Kosala Hemachandra from MyEtherWallet, he, like, said ethereum is just a "value token" that "inhibits all use cases built on top." Which sounds pretty harsh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and I remember Kosala Hemachandra from MyEtherWallet, he, like, said ethereum is just a value token that inhibits all use cases built on top. Which sounds pretty harsh.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unlike bitcoin, ethereum is not just a value token, meaning it actually fuels all use cases built on top of the ETH blockchain, Kosala Hemachandra, the chief executive of MyEtherWallet, said in emailed comments...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It does. Meanwhile, bitcoin is often seen as a simpler value token, with a much clearer roadmap. So, while both have seen recent surges, the long-term outlook for market dominance is, uh, still very much up for debate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does. Meanwhile, bitcoin is often seen as a simpler value token, with a much clearer roadmap. So, while both have seen recent surges, the long-term outlook for market dominance is, uh, still very much up for debate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bitcoin is simply a value token with no clear roadmap.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It’s certainly a space to keep watching, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's certainly a space to keep watching, isn't it?
